thread.title: High school roundup: Erin Hallenbeck's goal lifts Taconic Hills to field hockey sectional win
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Erin Hallenbeck's goal lifts Taconic Hills to field hockey sectional win - Times Union

author: Staff report
title: High school roundup: Erin Hallenbeck's goal lifts Taconic Hills to field hockey sectional win
text:
Erin Hallenbeck scored with nine minutes, six seconds left in the first half and sixth-seeded Taconic Hills held on for a 1-0 victory over No. 11 Salem in a Section II Class C preliminary field hockey game Monday afternoon.
Laylah Thompson assisted on the goal for the Titans, who improved to 10-5.
Hannah Waldorf made three saves for Taconic Hills and Jessica Vidale stopped seven shots for the Generals.
Taconic Hills will face third-seeded Germantown at 3 p.m. Tuesday at Germantown in a quarterfinal encounter.
More field hockey: Cate Hill scored in the shootout to lift No. 8 North Warren past No. 9 Granville in another Class C preliminary game. North Warren got a goal from Sydney Gagnon and five saves from Morgan Yarosh. Granville got a goal from Bre Greenough and 13 saves from Cheyenne Oakman. North Warren will play at 3 p.m. Tuesday at No. 1 Hoosick Falls in a quarterfinal test.
Boys' soccer: Ballston Spa finished its regular season with a 16-0 record by blanking visiting Schenectady 2-0 in a Suburban Council test. Griffen MacWatters scored in the first half and Connor DeFilippis added an insurance goal in the second half. ... Visiting Voorheesville scored four goals in the second half and went on to a 5-0 victory over Cohoes in a Colonial Council contest. The Blackbirds got two goals from Sean Nolan and one goal and one assist from Braden Racey .
Girls' soccer: Saratoga Springs' Ya'nique Van Ness outdueled Queensbury's Brittany LaPlant in a nonleague game. Van Ness scored five goals to lead the Blue Streaks (11-3-2) to the 5-3 win. LaPlant scored three times for the Spartans. ... Veda Hensel had one goal and two assists and teammate Julia Voss added a goal and an assist as Voorheesville blanked Cohoes 4-0 in a Colonial Council game. The Blackbirds improved to 15-1.
Girls' volleyball: Burnt Hills got past Shenendehowa 25-14, 25-27, 25-23, 23-25 and 25-19 to stretch its Suburban Council winning streak to 376 matches. Natalie Schurman had 15 kills and 22 digs to lead the Spartans (25-1, 15-0). Shenendehowa (16-2, 15-1) got 20 kills, seven blocks and four digs from Nicole Adams . ... Averill Park swept past Shaker by scores of 25-14, 25-19 and 25-10. The Warriors, who improved to 17-3 overall and 13-3 in the league, got eight kills from Maddy Dunigan and seven from Kaity Ludder. Shaker (5-8) got 20 digs from Shelby Connors .
